title: Records Request - Carroll County State's Attorney's Office (United States Attorney's Office, District Of Maryland)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern at the United State’s Attorney’s Office in the District of Maryland,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. Sec. 552 (“FOIA”), I request the following records on behalf of Civil Rights Corps:

1. Any and all emails in the possession of the Maryland Attorney General’s Office that contain the word “Buenger” in reference to Carroll County Deputy Sheriff Sean Buenger.

2. Any and all written or otherwise recorded correspondence between employees of the Maryland Attorney General’s Office and employees of the Carroll County State’s Attorney’s Office regarding any of the following subjects:
- Carroll County Deputy Sheriff Sean Buenger
- State v. Jared Specht, C-06-CR-22-000044
- State v. Betty Montgomery, C-06-CR-21-000764
- State v. Samar Williams, C-06-CR-21-000763
- State v. Barry Lee Haines, case name unknown to us.

In particular, please include written or otherwise recorded correspondence regarding Deputy Buenger and/or any of the three named cases between LaRai Everett, Assistant United State’s Attorney at the District of Maryland Office, and Jennifer Brady, former Carroll County Assistant State’s Attorney, and/or Allan Culver, former Carroll County Assistant State’s Attorney, between February 2022 and August 2022. Responsive materials may include, but are not limited to; video recordings, audio recordings, or written materials. Written materials may include but are not limited to; emails; messages sent via MMS, SMS, text, or messaging applications such as WhatsApp, GroupMe, or Signal; and messages or other communications on social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter/X, Instagram, BeReal, or Snapchat.

Please search for responsive records regardless of format, medium or physical characteristics, including electronic records. Please provide the requested documents in the following format:
- Saved on a CD, CD-ROM or DVD
- In PDF or TIF format
- In electronically searchable format
- Each record in a separately saved PDF file
- “Parent-child” relationships maintained, meaning that the requester must be able to identify the attachments with emails
- Any data records in native format (i.e. Excel spreadsheets in Excel)
- Emails should include BCC and any other hidden fields
- With any other metadata preserved

Civil Rights Corps (CRC) (www.civilrighscorps.org) is a nonprofit, public interest, legal civil rights advocacy organization in the United States that engages in litigation and public advocacy in the field of civil rights. CRC has no commercial interest in the requested documents and may transmit the requested information on its website, social media, or other form to inform the public. The requested materials may also be used as the foundation for future legal work.

The requesters are entitled to a fee waiver pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k) and 28 C.F.R. § 16.10 (k) on the grounds that “disclosure of the records is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to the public understanding of the activities or operations of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the request[s].” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). See also 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k) (records furnished by DHS without charge if the information is in the public interest, and disclosure is not in the commercial interest of the institution); 28 C.F.R. § 16.10 (k) (records furnished by DOJ without charge if the information is in the public interest, and disclosure is not in the commercial interest of the institution). 

Requesters meet the requirements for a fee waiver because the subject of the request concerns the operations or activities of the government; the disclosure of the information is likely to contribute to a significant public understanding of government operations or activities due to the requesters’ expertise in the subject area and ability to convey the information; the Requesters’ primary interest is in disclosure; and they have no commercial interest in the information.

In the alternative, we request a limitation of processing fees pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). (“[F]ees shall be limited to reasonable standard charges for document duplication when records are not sought for commercial use and the request is made by . . . a representative of the news media.”). See also 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(d)(1); 28 C.F.R. § 16.10(d)(1). If no fee waiver is granted, please contact the Requesters’ undersigned counsel prior to incurring any additional fees.

 If possible, please fulfill the request electronically, via MuckRock or by e-mail attachment if available, and by CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 30 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Civil Rights Corps
